findings.title: Use of Upgradable Contract Design
findings.description: The logic of affected contracts can be arbitrarily changed, allowing the proxy contract owner to perform malicious actions such as stealing users' funds.

findings.title: Improper Condition Checking in setRewardPath() Function
findings.description: The work() function will be unusable since the _reinvest() function will revert the transaction due to the swapping of invalid tokens, resulting in failed executions on all strategies, including the users' close position transactions.

findings.title: Centralized Control of State Variable
findings.description: The controlling authorities can change critical state variables to gain additional profit, which is unfair to other users.

findings.title: Transaction Ordering Dependence for Beneficial Vault Bounty
findings.description: The front-running attack can be performed, resulting in a bad swapping rate for the beneficial vault bounty.

findings.title: Transaction Ordering Dependence for Reinvestment Balance
findings.description: The front-running attack can be performed, resulting in a bad swapping rate for the reinvestment and lower reward for the platform users.

findings.title: Improper Transfer of Reinvest Token
findings.description: A small part of the $MDX token used for the reinvestment can be transferred out by the contract owner, resulting in less reward for the platform users.

findings.title: Outdated Compiler Version
findings.description: The Solidity compiler versions specified in the smart contracts were outdated, which may potentially cause damage to the smart contracts or users due to publicly known inherent bugs.

findings.title: Insufficient Logging for Privileged Functions
findings.description: Privileged functions that are executable by the controlling parties are not logged properly by emitting events.

findings.title: Improper Function Visibility
findings.description: The initialize() function's visibility should be changed to external if it is not called from any internal function.
